project.title: Minist√©rio Resgate de Almas
project.description:
[EN]

# üôè Purpose

> ‚ÄúLove God above all things and your neighbor as yourself.‚Äù

Our main goal is the **regeneration of people above all** ‚Äî regeneration means to be born again.

---

# üìñ The Story

It all began with the **conversion of Pastor Luiz Cl√°udio**, who left drug trafficking and went through a deep spiritual transformation. This led to the creation of the **Ministry Resgate de Almas (Soul Rescue)**, founded to welcome and protect people in similar situations ‚Äî victims of community violence and addiction.

We built a **rehabilitation house**, where we received drug addicts at risk of death, took care of them, and provided shelter, spiritual support, food, and safety. Many were regenerated, and we have over **200 recorded testimonies**.

> _Photos of newspaper covers + before and after pictures_

![Newspaper covers](https://i.postimg.cc/bY4gq9gx/Foto-01.png)

![Before and after 1](https://i.postimg.cc/52VmC9Zj/Foto-02.png)
![Before and after 2](https://i.postimg.cc/3JpBN0fP/Foto-03.png)
![Before and after 3](https://i.postimg.cc/jS44Q0bc/Foto-04.png)
![Before and after 4](https://i.postimg.cc/8CkBZKkS/Foto-05.png)

Unfortunately, last year the house suffered from **severe water leakage problems**, and we had to transfer the residents to another improvised place.

---

# üôå Present Days

Today, we continue our mission with full strength through social actions like:

- **Food distribution** (groceries, fresh produce, basic food kits, hot soup meals);
- **Donations of wheelchairs, walkers, and crutches**;
- **Clothing and hygiene items**;
- Emergency support for families facing hunger and neglect;
- Cleaning and revitalization of a **land area over 2,000m¬≤**, where we plan to build more.

> _Photos of current actions: food donations, equipment, community cleanups, etc._

![Food distribution](https://i.postimg.cc/FR7b4YJC/Foto-06.png)
![Food distribution](https://i.postimg.cc/j5mHdRHx/Foto-07.png)
![Food distribution](https://i.postimg.cc/LsykwthZ/Foto-08.png)
![Food distribution](https://i.postimg.cc/zDHw2RNV/Foto-09.png)
![Equipment donations](https://i.postimg.cc/SN06BNQV/Foto-10.png)
![Kombi outreach](https://i.postimg.cc/2yW41gG4/Foto-11.png)
![Fruits and vegetables](https://i.postimg.cc/X7wf4SpW/Foto-12.png)

---

# üõ†Ô∏è The Proposal

Our next big step is to **build a community kitchen** on this land. It will be used to:

- Prepare **solidarity soup meals** and daily meals;
- Serve people suffering from hunger;
- Act as an emergency support center.

We also plan to build a **community garden** in the same space, to provide fresh and healthy food to the kitchen. The land has rich soil and more than **2,000m¬≤ available** for this mission.

> _Photo of the construction materials receipt_

![Construction receipt](https://i.postimg.cc/C138pm0d/image.png)

## üß± Materials Budget (based on the receipt)

| Item                          | Quantity        | Price (BRL)     |
|-------------------------------|-----------------|-----------------|
| Beams, siphons, hoses         | Various         | 110.14          |
| Screws, faucets               | Various         | 126.00          |
| Corrugated roofing sheets     | 30m¬≤            | 1,798.50        |
| Cement, sand, gravel          | Various sacks   | 1,977.70        |
| Toilet + fittings             | 2 units         | 1,198.95        |
| Bricks + granite              | 1,000 units     | 2,224.95        |
| Other plumbing materials      | Various         | 1,273.70        |
| **Total**                     |                 | **R$ 10,708.94** |

---

# Conclusion

As you can see, we have **one mission: to regenerate lives** ‚Äî and with your support, we will go even further! Never underestimate the power of a person from S√£o Gon√ßalo with the will to help others! üòÑ Big hugs!

---

**P.S.**

Photo of Pastor Luiz Cl√°udio with the GreenPill crew:

![Pastor Luiz Cl√°udio with GreenPill](https://i.postimg.cc/DfCV6H22/image.png)

[BR]

# üôè Prop√≥sito

> ‚ÄúAmar a Deus acima de todas as coisas e ao pr√≥ximo como a si mesmo.‚Äù

Nosso objetivo √© a **regenera√ß√£o de pessoas acima de tudo** ‚Äî regenera√ß√£o significa nascer de novo.

---

# üìñ A Hist√≥ria

Tudo come√ßou com a **convers√£o do Pastor Luiz Cl√°udio**, que saiu do tr√°fico e passou por um processo profundo de transforma√ß√£o espiritual. Com isso nasceu o **Minist√©rio Resgate de Almas**, fundado para acolher e proteger pessoas em situa√ß√£o semelhante, v√≠timas da viol√™ncia das comunidades e do v√≠cio.

Criamos uma **casa de reabilita√ß√£o**, onde receb√≠amos dependentes qu√≠micos em risco de vida, cuid√°vamos deles e oferec√≠amos abrigo, apoio espiritual, alimenta√ß√£o e prote√ß√£o. Muitos foram regenerados e temos mais de **200 testemunhos contados**.

> _Aqui entra o espa√ßo para as fotos de capas de jornais + fotos de antes e depois_

![Capas de jornal](https://i.postimg.cc/bY4gq9gx/Foto-01.png)

> _Aqui entra o espa√ßo para as fotos de capas de jornais + fotos de antes e depois_

![Antes e depois 1](https://i.postimg.cc/52VmC9Zj/Foto-02.png)
![Antes e depois 2](https://i.postimg.cc/3JpBN0fP/Foto-03.png)
![Antes e depois 3](https://i.postimg.cc/jS44Q0bc/Foto-04.png)
![Antes e depois 3](https://i.postimg.cc/8CkBZKkS/Foto-05.png)

Mas ano passado infelizmente, a casa teve **problemas graves de infiltra√ß√£o** e tivemos que transferir os acolhidos para outro espa√ßo improvisado.

---

# üôå Os Dias de Hoje

Hoje continuamos nossa miss√£o com for√ßa total atrav√©s de a√ß√µes sociais:

- **Distribui√ß√£o de alimentos** (feiras, cestas b√°sicas, hortifruti, sop√µes);
- **Doa√ß√µes de cadeiras de rodas, andadores e muletas**;
- **Roupas e itens de higiene**;
- Atendimento emergencial a fam√≠lias em situa√ß√£o de fome ou abandono;
- Renova√ß√£o e limpeza de um **terreno com mais de 2000m¬≤**, onde temos o sonho de construir mais.

> _Aqui entram as fotos das a√ß√µes atuais: doa√ß√µes de alimentos, cadeiras, mutir√£o, etc_

![Distribui√ß√£o de alimentos](https://i.postimg.cc/FR7b4YJC/Foto-06.png)
![Distribui√ß√£o de alimentos](https://i.postimg.cc/j5mHdRHx/Foto-07.png)
![Distribui√ß√£o de alimentos](https://i.postimg.cc/LsykwthZ/Foto-08.png)
![Distribui√ß√£o de alimentos](https://i.postimg.cc/zDHw2RNV/Foto-09.png)
![Doa√ß√µes de cadeiras de rodas e muletas](https://i.postimg.cc/SN06BNQV/Foto-10.png)
![Mutir√£o com a Kombi](https://i.postimg.cc/2yW41gG4/Foto-11.png)
![Feiras e hortifruti](https://i.postimg.cc/X7wf4SpW/Foto-12.png)

---

# üõ†Ô∏è A Proposta

Nosso pr√≥ximo grande passo √© **construir uma cozinha social comunit√°ria** no terreno. Ela ser√° usada para:

- Preparar **sop√µes solid√°rios** e refei√ß√µes di√°rias;
- Acolher pessoas em situa√ß√£o de fome;
- Ser ponto de apoio emergencial.

Tamb√©m queremos montar, no mesmo espa√ßo, uma **horta comunit√°ria** para abastecer a cozinha com alimentos frescos e saud√°veis. O terreno tem solo f√©rtil e mais de **2000m¬≤ dispon√≠veis** para essa miss√£o.

> _Espa√ßo para a foto do recibo de material de constru√ß√£o_

![Recibo da obra](https://i.postimg.cc/C138pm0d/image.png)

## üß± Or√ßamento dos materiais (com base no recibo)

| Item                            | Quantidade     | Valor (R$)     |
|---------------------------------|----------------|----------------|
| Vigas, sif√£o, rabicho           | Diversos       | 110,14         |
| Parafusos, torneiras            | Diversos       | 126,00         |
| Telha ondulada                  | 30m¬≤           | 1.798,50       |
| Cimento, areia, pedra           | Sacos diversos | 1.977,70       |
| Vaso sanit√°rio + materiais      | 2 und          | 1.198,95       |
| Tijolo + granito                | 1.000 und      | 2.224,95       |
| Outros materiais hidr√°ulicos    | Diversos       | 1.273,70       |
| **Total**                       |                | **R$ 10.708,94** |

---

# Conclus√£o

Ent√£o como voc√™ pode ver n√≥s estamos com uma unica miss√£o regenerar vidas, e com o seu voto iremos ainda mais longe! Nunca desacredite em um poder de um gon√ßalense com vontade de ajuda o proximo kkkkk, abra√ßos.

---

Jogos desenvolvidos de forma respons√°vel, com menos tecnologia e mais diversidade em est√©tica e mec√¢nicas de jogo: menos competi√ß√£o, mais colabora√ß√£o. Atrav√©s de oficinas interativas e da cocria√ß√£o de ideias de jogos ecol√≥gicos, estamos capacitando jovens a se tornarem criadores conscientes no espa√ßo digital.

***Ativismo Educacional

Como mostrado por iniciativas como IGDA Climate, The Green Games Summit e Playing for the Planet, a ind√∫stria de jogos est√° gradualmente reconhecendo sua responsabilidade na luta contra as mudan√ßas clim√°ticas e o desenvolvimento sustent√°vel.

No entanto, uma mudan√ßa profunda tamb√©m √© necess√°ria do lado do consumidor. Promover maior conscientiza√ß√£o entre os jogadores, incentivando-os a apreciar est√©ticas diversas, jogabilidade alternativa e consci√™ncia dos impactos ambientais, √© um desafio chave. O ativismo educacional torna-se uma ferramenta essencial nesta jornada, n√£o apenas para promover e distribuir jogos ecol√≥gicos existentes, mas tamb√©m para incentivar a cria√ß√£o de novos. Ao fazer isso, o objetivo √© ampliar o escopo da est√©tica e das narrativas dos jogos, incentivando uma mentalidade que valoriza cosmogonias variadas, rela√ß√µes com o n√£o-humano e conex√µes hol√≠sticas.

***O que fazemos

Beyond Green Games √© uma iniciativa disruptiva que usa videogames para aumentar a consci√™ncia ambiental. Organizando oficinas, cursos de forma√ß√£o e exposi√ß√µes, e coproduzindo jogos e filmes, transforma jogadores em agentes de mudan√ßa.

Beyond Green Games | ECOJOGOS - kit para aprendizagens com videogames
√© inovador por v√°rias raz√µes:

-   **Hackeamento de Jogos:** Os participantes aprendem a "hackear" jogos, modificando-os e adaptando-os para criar novas experi√™ncias.
-   **Cocria√ß√£o e Cultura Maker:** A iniciativa enfatiza a colabora√ß√£o, o compartilhamento de conhecimento e a produ√ß√£o de conte√∫do original.

# Redes Sociais do Projeto
[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@beyondgreengames) - [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@beyond.green.games2033) - [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/beyond.green.games) - [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/beyond.green.games/)


[EN] Founded by French artist and game curator Isabelle Arvers and Brazilian carnival artist and filmmaker Livia Diniz, the Beyond Green Games aka in Brazil as ECOJOGOS - kit para aprendizagens com videogame is a disruptive and creative educational proposal to raise awareness about the environment through green games. The idea is to hack video games to encourage changes in behavior towards the environment, playing games that adopt animist and native peoples' perspectives, games that address narratives related to current climate challenges. Games developed responsibly, with less technology and more diversity in aesthetics and game mechanics: less competition, more collaboration. Through interactive workshops and the cocreation of eco-friendly game ideas, we're empowering young people to become conscious creators within the digital space.

***Educational activism

The need for educational activism in the field of environmental games is a promising way of tackling environmental issues and transforming the games landscape. As shown by initiatives such as IGDA Climate, The Green Games Summit and Playing for the Planet, the games industry is gradually recognising its responsibility in the fight against climate change and sustainable development.

However, a profound change is also needed on the consumer side. Promoting greater awareness among gamers, encouraging them to appreciate diverse aesthetics, alternative gameplay and awareness of environmental impacts, is a key challenge. Educational activism becomes an essential tool in this journey, not only to promote and distribute existing ecological games, but also to encourage the creation of new ones. In doing so, the aim is to broaden the scope of games' aesthetics and narratives, encouraging a mindset that values varied cosmogonies, relationships with the non-human and holistic connections.

***What we do

Beyond Green Games is a disruptive initiative that uses video games to raise environmental awareness. By organizing workshops, training courses, and exhibitions, and by co-producing games and films, it turns gamers into agents of change.

*Raise Environmental Awareness:* Create and curate video games that address environmental themes, immersing players in real-world challenges and solutions.

*Educate and Empower:* Offer workshops, training programs, and lab immersions to game developers, educators, and community leaders, equipping them with the tools to create impactful environmental games.

*Engage Communities:* Partner with local organizations and community groups to co-produce games and initiatives that address specific environmental concerns in their region.

Prototype development - Rio de Janeiro, 2024 at Futuros, Artes e Tecnologia: 

‚ÄúIMERS√ÉO ECOJOGOS‚Äù
Images in this link : https://photos.app.goo.gl/69oj2Q2Myp99tvve8

OBSERVE, FEEL, HACK, CO-CREATE, CARE
METHODOLOGIES FOR EXPERIMENTING WITH DIGITAL GAMES

**AUGMENTED WALKS**
Walks in parks to record sounds, images, and 3D scans of trees, rocks, and other more-than-human beings.

**MACHINIMAS**
Co-creation of films made with video games, mixing recordings of green game sequences with recordings made during augmented walks.

**ECO-GAMES IN ONIRICOSYMBIOTIC HACKING**
Meeting open to the public to celebrate and present the production of sounds, images, ideas, and machinima made.

Beyond Green Games | ECOJOGOS - kit para aprendizagens com videogames 
is innovative for several reasons:

- **Game Hacking:** Participants learn to "hack" games, modifying and adapting them to create new experiences.
- **Co-creation and Maker Culture:** The initiative emphasizes collaboration, knowledge sharing, and the production of original content.
- **Bridging the Digital and Physical:** The project integrates elements of the physical world, such as nature walks and the use of reused materials, with the digital realm of video games.
- **Focus on Sustainability:** The initiative addresses climate change and environmental preservation in a fun and engaging way, inspiring participants to create innovative solutions for global challenges.

### What impact will it have?
Beyond Green Games | ECOJOGOS - kit para aprendizagens com videogames 
has the potential to make a significant impact in various areas:
- **Video Game Industry:** It inspires new business models and fosters the creation of more conscious and socially responsible games.
- **Education:** It offers a novel approach to teaching science, technology, engineering, and math, making learning more fun and relevant.
- **Sustainability:** It raises awareness of environmental issues and encourages sustainable practices.
- **Culture:** It promotes creativity, innovation, and cultural diversity.


# Project Socials  
[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@beyondgreengames) - [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@beyond.green.games2033) - [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/beyond.green.games) - [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/beyond.green.games/)

- **L√≠via Diniz**: An artist and carnival creative director dedicated to co-creating experiences and spaces for play, designing transdisciplinary and intergenerational projects that generate community engagement and exchanges between transnational learning networks. With 13 years of international experience in 18 countries, her current focus is on realizing high-impact projects that influence and are incorporated into national public policies. [More about L√≠via](https://www.parcdinventions.net/equipe) | [Maraberto Filmes](https://marabertofilmes.com.br/livia-diniz/)

- **Isabelle Arvers**: An artist and curator whose research focuses on the interaction between art and video games. In 2019, she began a world tour investigating the artistic, ethical, and critical implications related to art and digital games in 17 countries. D. in Art & Games Decolonisation proposes experiences that play with various artistic and social possibilities for transforming imaginaries. [More about Isabelle](https://www.isabellearvers.com/biography/) | [References](https://www.isabellearvers.com/references/)

### Collaborating Organizations
- **Kareron**: Co-creation and project development. A non-profit organization set up in 2014 to promote, disseminate, produce, and communicate artistic and educational projects in the fields of art, digital creation, and video games.
 
- **Invention Parks**: An international learning network where children, teenagers, and artists collaborate and express themselves through artistic, social, and scientific experiments.
 
- **Futures - Art and Technology**: A space where art, science, and technology converge, organizing traveling exhibitions that value diverse artistic expressions and languages.
 
- **NAVE - N√∫cleo Avan√ßado em Educa√ß√£o**: A program developed by Oi Futuro in partnership with state education departments in Brazil, integrating secondary education with professional and technological education.
 
- **Fabulosa Lab**: A maker community founded in 2014 in Rio de Janeiro to create projects combining art, technology, and movement.
 
- **FARO/Fluxonomy Applied to Organisational Redesign**: Project design, monitoring, and evaluation.
 
- **French Consulate in Rio de Janeiro**: Support for international mobility and connection with local partnerships.
 
- **Southern Region and Department 13 of the French Government**: Financial support for purchasing equipment and prototyping the pilot project in Marseille.
 
- **Ministry of the Environment**: Partnership under development for approval and inclusion of the project in public policy planning.

### Estimated Total Team
- 2 core founders investing resources and working continuously since 2022
- 15-20 people across different organizations collaborating sporadically

## Project Active Duration
**Project conception:**  
Brussels, Belgium  
September and October 2022: Ana√Øs Berck‚Äôs residency for the development of algoliterary publications.

### Recent Major Activities:
**Marseille, France**  
October 2024 - March 2025: Workshops with 14 art, cinema, and NIS students.

**Rio de Janeiro, Brazil**  
- February and March 2024: Face-to-face meetings in Rio and S√£o Paulo.
- April to December 2024: Online meetings with partners and possible funders.
- December 9 -17, 2024: ‚ÄúIMERS√ÉO ECOJOGOS, para al√©m dos videogames, brincando de sonhar‚Äù at Futuros - Art and Technology, Museum of the Republic‚Äôs gardens, and Fabulosa Lab.
- May, June and July, 2025 : development of reports, website and communication contents for founding and continuity of the project

## Planning and Impact
**What do we hope to achieve?**  
Create a community of conscious and engaged game creators, inspiring a new generation of developers to promote sustainability, diversity, and inclusion.

**How does this help game producers and the industry?**  
It offers developers a unique opportunity to explore new narrative and interactive possibilities.

**How does this help game consumers?**  
It empowers gamers by transforming them from mere consumers into content creators.

**How does this help public policies related to environmental education?**  
It provides an innovative model for environmental education that can be replicated in schools.

## Expected Outcomes (May - July)
- Create communication contents (report, evaluation, website, social media contents and pitch deck for presentations) for the initiative‚Äôs development in 2025 and 2026
- 15 posts on social networks (5 posts per month) and 3 updates on the website
- Engage 250 youngsters from Marseille to test the prototype developed in Rio in 2024 
- Plan actions for additional funding and government recognition for the initiative.

## Main Problem Addressed
Transforming video game culture to raise environmental awareness, encourage sustainable thinking, and empower youth as conscious digital creators.

## Geographic Scope
**Primary Locations:**  
- Rio de Janeiro (primary focus) - prototype cocreation
- Marseille, France (secondary project site) - prototype testing

metadata.title: Beyond Green Games | ECOJOGOS - kit para aprendizagens com videogame
metadata.description:
[PT-BR] bellow
:::::
[EN] Founded by French artist and game curator Isabelle Arvers and Brazilian carnival artist and filmmaker Livia Diniz, the Beyond Green Games aka in Brazil as ECOJOGOS - kit para aprendizagens com videogame is a disruptive and creative educational proposal to raise awareness about the environment through green games. The idea is to hack video games to encourage changes in behavior towards the environment, playing games that adopt animist and native peoples' perspectives, games that address narratives related to current climate challenges. Games developed responsibly, with less technology and more diversity in aesthetics and game mechanics: less competition, more collaboration. Through interactive workshops and the cocreation of eco-friendly game ideas, we're empowering young people to become conscious creators within the digital space.

***Educational activism

The need for educational activism in the field of environmental games is a promising way of tackling environmental issues and transforming the games landscape. As shown by initiatives such as IGDA Climate, The Green Games Summit and Playing for the Planet, the games industry is gradually recognising its responsibility in the fight against climate change and sustainable development.

However, a profound change is also needed on the consumer side. Promoting greater awareness among gamers, encouraging them to appreciate diverse aesthetics, alternative gameplay and awareness of environmental impacts, is a key challenge. Educational activism becomes an essential tool in this journey, not only to promote and distribute existing ecological games, but also to encourage the creation of new ones. In doing so, the aim is to broaden the scope of games' aesthetics and narratives, encouraging a mindset that values varied cosmogonies, relationships with the non-human and holistic connections.

***What we do

Beyond Green Games is a disruptive initiative that uses video games to raise environmental awareness. By organizing workshops, training courses, and exhibitions, and by co-producing games and films, it turns gamers into agents of change.

*Raise Environmental Awareness:* Create and curate video games that address environmental themes, immersing players in real-world challenges and solutions.

*Educate and Empower:* Offer workshops, training programs, and lab immersions to game developers, educators, and community leaders, equipping them with the tools to create impactful environmental games.

*Engage Communities:* Partner with local organizations and community groups to co-produce games and initiatives that address specific environmental concerns in their region.

Prototype development - Rio de Janeiro, 2024 at Futuros, Artes e Tecnologia: 

‚ÄúIMERS√ÉO ECOJOGOS‚Äù
Images in this link : https://photos.app.goo.gl/69oj2Q2Myp99tvve8

OBSERVE, FEEL, HACK, CO-CREATE, CARE
METHODOLOGIES FOR EXPERIMENTING WITH DIGITAL GAMES

**AUGMENTED WALKS**
Walks in parks to record sounds, images, and 3D scans of trees, rocks, and other more-than-human beings.

**MACHINIMAS**
Co-creation of films made with video games, mixing recordings of green game sequences with recordings made during augmented walks.

**ECO-GAMES IN ONIRICOSYMBIOTIC HACKING**
Meeting open to the public to celebrate and present the production of sounds, images, ideas, and machinima made.

Beyond Green Games | ECOJOGOS - kit para aprendizagens com videogames 
is innovative for several reasons:

- **Game Hacking:** Participants learn to "hack" games, modifying and adapting them to create new experiences.
- **Co-creation and Maker Culture:** The initiative emphasizes collaboration, knowledge sharing, and the production of original content.
- **Bridging the Digital and Physical:** The project integrates elements of the physical world, such as nature walks and the use of reused materials, with the digital realm of video games.
- **Focus on Sustainability:** The initiative addresses climate change and environmental preservation in a fun and engaging way, inspiring participants to create innovative solutions for global challenges.

### What impact will it have?
Beyond Green Games | ECOJOGOS - kit para aprendizagens com videogames 
has the potential to make a significant impact in various areas:
- **Video Game Industry:** It inspires new business models and fosters the creation of more conscious and socially responsible games.
- **Education:** It offers a novel approach to teaching science, technology, engineering, and math, making learning more fun and relevant.
- **Sustainability:** It raises awareness of environmental issues and encourages sustainable practices.
- **Culture:** It promotes creativity, innovation, and cultural diversity.


# Project Socials  
[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@beyondgreengames) - [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@beyond.green.games2033) - [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/beyond.green.games) - [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/beyond.green.games/)

## Contact
- **Payout Wallet Address:** eth:0x5810bA006c2a4B3A602B68caAeD15c2cb47bf2d3
- **Email:** beyongreengames@gmail.com

## Project Context
### Past Funding Sources
**Fundings from France:**  
- Anais Berk‚Äôs residency (cocreation and artistic experimentations): 3,250.00 euros
- French Consulate in Rio de Janeiro (financial support for international mobility): 2,000.00 euros
- R√©gion Sud (15,590.00 euros) and D√©partement 13 (2,160.00 euros) to carry out the ECOJOGOS project throughout 2024 and 2025 in a school in Marseille, with augmented walks carried out in gardens to record audio, video, and 3D scanning of more-than-human elements, integrating them into video games with machinima workshops (videos made with video games). This support includes a ‚Ç¨13,091 investment from R√©gion Sud to purchase computer and audiovisual equipment used in the workshops held in December 2024 in Rio de Janeiro.

**Founders and partners investments:** time, spaces, equipment, trips for networking, academic and specialized certifications, communication content, research, and development.

**Approximate total funding:** 23,000.00 euros | 142,000.00 reais

### Team Size
**Core Founders:** 2 (Livia Diniz and Isabelle Arvers)

- **L√≠via Diniz**: An artist and carnival creative director dedicated to co-creating experiences and spaces for play, designing transdisciplinary and intergenerational projects that generate community engagement and exchanges between transnational learning networks. With 13 years of international experience in 18 countries, her current focus is on realizing high-impact projects that influence and are incorporated into national public policies. [More about L√≠via](https://www.parcdinventions.net/equipe) | [Maraberto Filmes](https://marabertofilmes.com.br/livia-diniz/)

- **Isabelle Arvers**: An artist and curator whose research focuses on the interaction between art and video games. In 2019, she began a world tour investigating the artistic, ethical, and critical implications related to art and digital games in 17 countries. D. in Art & Games Decolonisation proposes experiences that play with various artistic and social possibilities for transforming imaginaries. [More about Isabelle](https://www.isabellearvers.com/biography/) | [References](https://www.isabellearvers.com/references/)

### Collaborating Organizations
- **Kareron**: Co-creation and project development. A non-profit organization set up in 2014 to promote, disseminate, produce, and communicate artistic and educational projects in the fields of art, digital creation, and video games.
 
- **Invention Parks**: An international learning network where children, teenagers, and artists collaborate and express themselves through artistic, social, and scientific experiments.
 
- **Futures - Art and Technology**: A space where art, science, and technology converge, organizing traveling exhibitions that value diverse artistic expressions and languages.
 
- **NAVE - N√∫cleo Avan√ßado em Educa√ß√£o**: A program developed by Oi Futuro in partnership with state education departments in Brazil, integrating secondary education with professional and technological education.
 
- **Fabulosa Lab**: A maker community founded in 2014 in Rio de Janeiro to create projects combining art, technology, and movement.
 
- **FARO/Fluxonomy Applied to Organisational Redesign**: Project design, monitoring, and evaluation.
 
- **French Consulate in Rio de Janeiro**: Support for international mobility and connection with local partnerships.
 
- **Southern Region and Department 13 of the French Government**: Financial support for purchasing equipment and prototyping the pilot project in Marseille.
 
- **Ministry of the Environment**: Partnership under development for approval and inclusion of the project in public policy planning.

### Estimated Total Team
- 2 core founders investing resources and working continuously since 2022
- 15-20 people across different organizations collaborating sporadically

## Project Active Duration
**Project conception:**  
Brussels, Belgium  
September and October 2022: Ana√Øs Berck‚Äôs residency for the development of algoliterary publications.

### Recent Major Activities:
**Marseille, France**  
October 2024 - March 2025: Workshops with 14 art, cinema, and NIS students.

**Rio de Janeiro, Brazil**  
- February and March 2024: Face-to-face meetings in Rio and S√£o Paulo.
- April to December 2024: Online meetings with partners and possible funders.
- December 9 -17, 2024: ‚ÄúIMERS√ÉO ECOJOGOS, para al√©m dos videogames, brincando de sonhar‚Äù at Futuros - Art and Technology, Museum of the Republic‚Äôs gardens, and Fabulosa Lab.
- May, June and July, 2025 : development of reports, website and communication contents for founding and continuity of the project

## Planning and Impact
**What do we hope to achieve?**  
Create a community of conscious and engaged game creators, inspiring a new generation of developers to promote sustainability, diversity, and inclusion.

**How does this help game producers and the industry?**  
It offers developers a unique opportunity to explore new narrative and interactive possibilities.

**How does this help game consumers?**  
It empowers gamers by transforming them from mere consumers into content creators.

**How does this help public policies related to environmental education?**  
It provides an innovative model for environmental education that can be replicated in schools.

## Expected Outcomes (May - July)
- Create communication contents (report, evaluation, website, social media contents and pitch deck for presentations) for the initiative‚Äôs development in 2025 and 2026
- 15 posts on social networks (5 posts per month) and 3 updates on the website
- Engage 250 youngsters from Marseille to test the prototype developed in Rio in 2024 
- Plan actions for additional funding and government recognition for the initiative.

## Main Problem Addressed
Transforming video game culture to raise environmental awareness, encourage sustainable thinking, and empower youth as conscious digital creators.

## Geographic Scope
**Primary Locations:**  
- Rio de Janeiro (primary focus) - prototype cocreation
- Marseille, France (secondary project site) - prototype testing

project.title: Limpeza de Praias
project.description:
**[ENG]**
We are a nonprofit initiative dedicated to recovering waste from beaches, rivers, and lagoons, aiming to restore coastal ecosystems and protect conservation areas. In our first two years of operation, we have conducted over 180 cleanup actions and removed more than 8 tons of waste across five states in Brazil.

[![IMG-1.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/YCQfZsGm/IMG-8406.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/PCrw8KMt)

In addition to our recurring cleanups, we are expanding our efforts to include planting native seedlings, helping to restore coastal vegetation. To make this possible, we rely on the support of individuals, businesses, and Web3 communities who believe in our mission and help sustain our activities.

[![16-Ba-a-de-Guanabara.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/SKBmK4WD/16-Ba-a-de-Guanabara.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/FfVMP2CL)

All our processes are documented and shared on our social media, turning each cleanup into an opportunity for environmental education. By showcasing the results of our actions, we aim to inspire and raise awareness about the importance of preservation and the impact of our actions on the planet.

[![5-Ba-a-de-Guanabara.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/256x5Rzb/5-Ba-a-de-Guanabara.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/VJxt7h0m)

**[POR]**
Somos uma iniciativa sem fins lucrativos dedicada √† recupera√ß√£o de lixo de praias, rios e lagoas, com o objetivo de restaurar os ecossistemas costeiros e proteger √°reas de preserva√ß√£o. Em nossos dois primeiros anos de atividade, realizamos mais de 180 a√ß√µes de limpeza e retiramos mais de 8 toneladas de lixo em cinco estados do Brasil.\

[![IMG-3133-1.avif](https://i.postimg.cc/jdX4TdzQ/IMG-3133-1.avif)](https://postimg.cc/1f8qcS7f)

Al√©m das limpezas recorrentes, estamos expandindo nossas iniciativas para incluir o plantio de mudas nativas, ajudando a restaurar a vegeta√ß√£o costeira. Para isso, contamos com o apoio de pessoas, empresas e comunidades da Web3, que acreditam no nosso prop√≥sito e ajudam a viabilizar nossas a√ß√µes de forma cont√≠nua.

[![26cb28d2-9e73-4e4c-bad9-30e98243adbc.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/8C4XcmQc/26cb28d2-9e73-4e4c-bad9-30e98243adbc.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/nssGw7Lf)

Todo o nosso processo √© documentado e compartilhado em nossas redes sociais, transformando cada a√ß√£o de limpeza em uma oportunidade de educa√ß√£o ambiental. Ao mostrar os resultados das nossas atividades, buscamos inspirar e conscientizar cada vez mais pessoas sobre a import√¢ncia da preserva√ß√£o e o impacto das nossas a√ß√µes no planeta.

[![IMG-0548.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/QMM5hQXj/IMG-0548.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/qN9gGChF)

project.title: √ÅrvoreSer
project.description:
‚Äú√ÅrvoreSer: agroecological reflections and practices‚Äù is a university extension project at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ) that aims to promote theoretical discussions, pedagogical practices and management in agroecology. At the Nupem Institute of Biodiversity and Sustainability, which is aimed at undergraduate courses in Biological Sciences and other postgraduate courses in Maca√©, this project is today a consolidating didactic model of agroforestry. Institutionalized about a year ago, ‚Äú√Årvore-Ser‚Äù is a successful example of scientific and pedagogical innovation in the recovery and transformation of a degraded area into an educational and agricultural space that combines biodiverse reforestation with sustainable agricultural production. This is because, as it takes place within the university environment, in addition to productivity, the space was designed to receive classes as a living didactic laboratory. The work carried out in the project includes management, planting, experiences, harvests, gatherings, sharing, debates, collective work, research, field classes and extension activities. Thus, the project is a cutting-edge experience at the institute, which, after approximately 30 years of its foundation, was the first initiative to implement a SAF, including among other courses and campuses of UFRJ or other universities in Maca√©. Thus, despite this condition and scarce resources, in this recently implemented agroforestry system (SAF) with an area of ‚Äã‚Äãapproximately 450 square meters, many fruits and experiences have already been harvested and shared. Among the harvests were, for example: corn, red and pigeon beans, carrots, pumpkin, cassava, banana, melon, gherkin, sugar cane, cabbage, etc. But, in addition to this, it is also where various educational practices and field classes are held with classes ranging from primary education to postgraduate studies.

-------------------------------------------------



**O ‚Äú√Årvore-ser: reflex√µes e pr√°ticas agroecol√≥gicas‚Äù √© um projeto de extens√£o universit√°ria na Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ) que tem como objetivo promover discuss√µes te√≥ricas, pr√°ticas pedag√≥gicas e de manejo em agroecologia. No Instituto de Biodiversidade e Sustentabilidade Nupem, o qual √© voltado a cursos de gradua√ß√£o em Ci√™ncias Biol√≥gicas e outros de p√≥s-gradua√ß√£o em Maca√©, tal projeto hoje √© um modelo did√°tico de agrofloresta em consolida√ß√£o. Institucionalizado h√° cerca de um ano, o ‚Äú√Årvore-Ser‚Äù √© um exemplo exitoso de inova√ß√£o cient√≠fica e pedag√≥gica na recupera√ß√£o e transforma√ß√£o de uma √°rea degradada em um espa√ßo educacional e agr√≠cola que concilia o reflorestamento biodiverso √† produ√ß√£o agr√≠cola sustent√°vel. Isto porque, por se dar dentro do ambiente universit√°rio, para al√©m da produtividade, o espa√ßo foi projetado para receber turmas enquanto um laborat√≥rio did√°tico vivo. Dentre os trabalhos realizados no projeto pode-se citar os manejos, plantios, viv√™ncias, colheitas, confraterniza√ß√µes, compartilhamentos, debates, mutir√µes, pesquisas, aulas de campo e atividades de extens√£o. Sendo assim, o projeto est√° a ser uma experi√™ncia de vanguarda no instituto no qual, ap√≥s cerca de 30 anos de sua funda√ß√£o, foi a primeira iniciativa de implementa√ß√£o de um SAF, inclusive dentre os demais cursos e polos interiores da UFRJ ou outras universidades em Maca√©. Assim, apesar dessa condi√ß√£o e dos recursos escassos, neste sistema agroflorestal (SAF)  rec√©m  implementado com √°rea aproximada de 450 metros quadrados j√° foram colhidos e compartilhados muitos frutos e viv√™ncias. Dentre a colheita teve-se, por exemplo: milho, feij√£o vermelho e guandu, cenoura, ab√≥bora, aipim, banana, mel√£o, maxixe, cana-de-a√ß√∫car, couve e etc. Mas, para al√©m disso, tamb√©m √© onde s√£o realizadas diversas pr√°ticas pedag√≥gicas e aulas de campo com turmas que variam desde a educa√ß√£o prim√°ria √† p√≥s-gradua√ß√£o.
Dessa forma, algumas centenas de estudantes por ano visitam o espa√ßo ‚Äù√Årvore-Ser‚Äù e passam a conhecer mais sobre o reflorestamento ativo com a produ√ß√£o de alimentos saud√°veis, org√¢nicos e responsabilidade socioambiental, evidenciando possibilidades do desenvolvimento sustent√°vel.

# 2022 - 2024 
In 2022, in a specific area of this university, a student-led movement implemented an agroforestry system (SAF) as a living educational laboratory called √ÅrvoreSer. Through student mobilization for reforestation and agroforestry production, this teaching-research-extension project emerged in the institution‚Äôs backyard. Thus, even though the initiative is situated within a Biological Sciences university environment, it was only through student organization that the critical theme of agroforestry began to gain traction at the institute.

The group of student representatives from √ÅrvoreSer, acting as extension workers for the project, has approximately 30 members, most of whom are women. However, participation levels among group representatives vary significantly, with an average of 7 to 8 students attending weekly meetings held every Friday.

By transforming an underutilized university space into an agroforestry site, the initiative integrates inter- and transdisciplinary approaches, exploring themes such as sustainability, food security, biodiversity, and the valuing of traditional knowledge. The project welcomes students and teachers from public schools in Maca√© and surrounding regions, as well as staff from the institute itself, fostering a mutual learning environment between rural and academic spheres. By expanding the meanings and perceptions of "nature," the project seeks to strengthen new relationships and modes of coexistence with soil, plants, and other living beings, promoting sustainability in its multiple dimensions.

The space aims to support research on topics like soil quality and dynamics, as well as biodiversity surveys of plants and other organisms. This research enhances the production of pedagogical materials for study group sessions and creates opportunities to organize events and lectures alongside school activities. These efforts aim to cultivate leadership among extension workers as educators and promote dialogic knowledge-sharing with diverse audiences (different age groups and academic backgrounds), serving as an exercise in teaching practice. Such experiences are vital for extension activities in educational spaces that encourage dialogue, knowledge exchange, and collaboration with local communities. A core pillar of the project is bridging academic knowledge with rural expertise, integrating and amplifying the construction of networks essential for advancing agroecology.


---
---

Dessa forma, apesar da experi√™ncia estar situada em um ambiente universit√°rio de Ci√™ncias Biol√≥gicas, foi apenas com a organiza√ß√£o estudantil que essa tem√°tica t√£o fundamental da agrofloresta passou a ser pautada no instituto.
O grupo de discentes representantes do √ÅrvoreSer enquanto extensionistas do projeto possui cerca de 30 membros, sendo composto por sua maioria de mulheres. No entanto, o grau de participa√ß√£o dos representantes do grupo √© bastante variado, possuindo uma m√©dia de 7 a 8 estudantes por encontro semanal realizado todas √†s sextas-feiras.  
A partir da transforma√ß√£o de um espa√ßo inutilizado da universidade em uma agrofloresta, a a√ß√£o integra abordagens inter e transdisciplinares, explorando temas como sustentabilidade, seguran√ßa alimentar, biodiversidade e a valoriza√ß√£o de saberes tradicionais. O projeto recebe no espa√ßo estudantes e professores de escolas p√∫blicas de Maca√© e regi√£o, al√©m de servidores do pr√≥prio instituto, criando um ambiente de aprendizado m√∫tuo entre o campo e a academia. Ao ampliar os sentidos e significados de "natureza", busca-se fortalecer novas rela√ß√µes e modos de exist√™ncia com o solo, as plantas e outros seres vivos, promovendo a sustentabilidade em suas m√∫ltiplas dimens√µes. 
Busca ser um espa√ßo para o desenvolvimento de pesquisas como a qualidade e din√¢mica do solo, levantamento de biodiversidade de plantas e outros organismos. Essas pesquisas potencializam a produ√ß√£o de material pedag√≥gico para encontros com grupos de estudos, al√©m de oportunizar a organiza√ß√£o de eventos e palestras em conjunto com as atividades escolares. Essas a√ß√µes pretendem desenvolver protagonismo dos extensionistas como educadores e a promo√ß√£o dial√≥gica do conhecimento constru√≠do com diferentes tipos de p√∫blico (faixas et√°rias, cursos), configurando um exerc√≠cio a doc√™ncia. Essas experi√™ncias s√£o importantes para atividades de extens√£o em espa√ßos de ensino-aprendizagem que permitem e estimulam di√°logos, trocas de conhecimentos e experi√™ncias com a comunidade local. A proposta ainda tem como pilar aproximar os conhecimentos universit√°rios dos saberes do campo, integralizando e potencializando a constru√ß√£o de redes importantes para o crescimento da agroecologia.

metadata.title: √ÅrvoreSer
metadata.description:
‚Äú√ÅrvoreSer: agroecological reflections and practices‚Äù is a university extension project at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ) that aims to promote theoretical discussions, pedagogical practices and management in agroecology. At the Nupem Institute of Biodiversity and Sustainability, which is aimed at undergraduate courses in Biological Sciences and other postgraduate courses in Maca√©, this project is today a consolidating didactic model of agroforestry. Institutionalized about a year ago, ‚Äú√Årvore-Ser‚Äù is a successful example of scientific and pedagogical innovation in the recovery and transformation of a degraded area into an educational and agricultural space that combines biodiverse reforestation with sustainable agricultural production. This is because, as it takes place within the university environment, in addition to productivity, the space was designed to receive classes as a living didactic laboratory. The work carried out in the project includes management, planting, experiences, harvests, gatherings, sharing, debates, collective work, research, field classes and extension activities. Thus, the project is a cutting-edge experience at the institute, which, after approximately 30 years of its foundation, was the first initiative to implement a SAF, including among other courses and campuses of UFRJ or other universities in Maca√©. Thus, despite this condition and scarce resources, in this recently implemented agroforestry system (SAF) with an area of ‚Äã‚Äãapproximately 450 square meters, many fruits and experiences have already been harvested and shared. Among the harvests were, for example: corn, red and pigeon beans, carrots, pumpkin, cassava, banana, melon, gherkin, sugar cane, cabbage, etc. But, in addition to this, it is also where various educational practices and field classes are held with classes ranging from primary education to postgraduate studies.

-------------------------------------------------



**O ‚Äú√Årvore-ser: reflex√µes e pr√°ticas agroecol√≥gicas‚Äù √© um projeto de extens√£o universit√°ria na Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ) que tem como objetivo promover discuss√µes te√≥ricas, pr√°ticas pedag√≥gicas e de manejo em agroecologia. No Instituto de Biodiversidade e Sustentabilidade Nupem, o qual √© voltado a cursos de gradua√ß√£o em Ci√™ncias Biol√≥gicas e outros de p√≥s-gradua√ß√£o em Maca√©, tal projeto hoje √© um modelo did√°tico de agrofloresta em consolida√ß√£o. Institucionalizado h√° cerca de um ano, o ‚Äú√Årvore-Ser‚Äù √© um exemplo exitoso de inova√ß√£o cient√≠fica e pedag√≥gica na recupera√ß√£o e transforma√ß√£o de uma √°rea degradada em um espa√ßo educacional e agr√≠cola que concilia o reflorestamento biodiverso √† produ√ß√£o agr√≠cola sustent√°vel. Isto porque, por se dar dentro do ambiente universit√°rio, para al√©m da produtividade, o espa√ßo foi projetado para receber turmas enquanto um laborat√≥rio did√°tico vivo. Dentre os trabalhos realizados no projeto pode-se citar os manejos, plantios, viv√™ncias, colheitas, confraterniza√ß√µes, compartilhamentos, debates, mutir√µes, pesquisas, aulas de campo e atividades de extens√£o. Sendo assim, o projeto est√° a ser uma experi√™ncia de vanguarda no instituto no qual, ap√≥s cerca de 30 anos de sua funda√ß√£o, foi a primeira iniciativa de implementa√ß√£o de um SAF, inclusive dentre os demais cursos e polos interiores da UFRJ ou outras universidades em Maca√©. Assim, apesar dessa condi√ß√£o e dos recursos escassos, neste sistema agroflorestal (SAF)  rec√©m  implementado com √°rea aproximada de 450 metros quadrados j√° foram colhidos e compartilhados muitos frutos e viv√™ncias. Dentre a colheita teve-se, por exemplo: milho, feij√£o vermelho e guandu, cenoura, ab√≥bora, aipim, banana, mel√£o, maxixe, cana-de-a√ß√∫car, couve e etc. Mas, para al√©m disso, tamb√©m √© onde s√£o realizadas diversas pr√°ticas pedag√≥gicas e aulas de campo com turmas que variam desde a educa√ß√£o prim√°ria √† p√≥s-gradua√ß√£o.
Dessa forma, algumas centenas de estudantes por ano visitam o espa√ßo ‚Äù√Årvore-Ser‚Äù e passam a conhecer mais sobre o reflorestamento ativo com a produ√ß√£o de alimentos saud√°veis, org√¢nicos e responsabilidade socioambiental, evidenciando possibilidades do desenvolvimento sustent√°vel.

The space aims to support research on topics like soil quality and dynamics, as well as biodiversity surveys of plants and other organisms. This research enhances the production of pedagogical materials for study group sessions and creates opportunities to organize events and lectures alongside school activities. These efforts aim to cultivate leadership among extension workers as educators and promote dialogic knowledge-sharing with diverse audiences (different age groups and academic backgrounds), serving as an exercise in teaching practice. Such experiences are vital for extension activities in educational spaces that encourage dialogue, knowledge exchange, and collaboration with local communities. A core pillar of the project is bridging academic knowledge with rural expertise, integrating and amplifying the construction of networks essential for advancing agroecology.

project.title: Santu√°rio das Fadas
project.description:
The Santu√°rio das Fadas, located in Teres√≥polis-RJ, is a pioneer in Brazil and was founded in 2008 by Patr√≠cia Fittipaldi, a veterinarian, vegan, and abolitionist for animal rights.

 We carry out work in sheltering, public health, awareness, and education, in addition to generating jobs for several low-income families.

The project began with the intention of rescuing and sheltering animals, especially farm animals, who were victims of mistreatment, abuse, and neglect.
 The idea arose because there were very few institutions dedicated to these species, unlike dogs and cats, for whom many organizations already existed.

At Santu√°rio das Fadas, we provide shelter to cattle, horses, pigs, goats, birds in general, some dogs, cats, rodents, and wild animals rescued from trafficking and other situations.

 Currently, the sanctuary is home to more than 300 animals. Many arrive in extremely fragile conditions and receive all the treatment and special care necessary to restore their self-esteem and dignity. Here, they live out their lives with love, respect, and freedom.

Santu√°rio das Fadas organizes charity events, bazaars, product sales, experiences, and campaigns to raise funds for its maintenance, in addition to receiving support from collaborators. The organization also rescues animals from illegal slaughterhouses, animals used for labor, and various other forms of exploitation. Some come from trafficking or other situations involving risk and mistreatment.

Furthermore, Santu√°rio das Fadas has been featured in newspaper articles, both printed and online, as well as in TV programs, always recognized as a pioneer and honorable project in Brazil. The sanctuary has also received two public utility titles acknowledging its outstanding work, along with other awards, honors, and recognitions‚Äîeven internationally.
Our principle is to provide rescued animals with a dignified, safe life filled with love and freedom, as all animals deserve.

Mission: Awakening Awareness and Transforming Destinies


Vision: A World of Respect, Compassion, and Unity with All Beings


Values: Strengthening the Foundations of Respect and Transformation

project.title: QUIAMA Project
project.description:
# QUIAMA Project: Science and Sustainability Transforming Lives

## WHAT IS QUIAMA?

Created in 2019 at IFRJ ‚Äì S√£o Gon√ßalo Campus, the QUIAMA Project combines agroecology and sustainable chemistry to promote environmental regeneration and social impact.

## WHERE DOES IT TAKE PLACE?

The project takes place in two complementary spaces:

‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†*Agroecological Garden* ‚Äì Cultivated and maintained by students, it produces pesticide-free plants.  
‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†*Organic Chemistry Laboratory* ‚Äì Where the plants are transformed into natural inputs.

![Image of the garden and laboratory](https://i.postimg.cc/HLM7PvsP/Foto-1.png)

## WHAT WE DO

‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†*Courses in favelas* ‚Äì Training in natural cosmetics and sustainability.  
‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†*Research & innovation* ‚Äì Sustainable alternatives for chemistry and the environment.  
‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†*Environmental education* ‚Äì Connecting science, nature, and society.

![Image of project activities](https://i.postimg.cc/vHmxdZZn/Foto-2.png)

## RECOGNITION

QUIAMA's impact has already been recognized with national and international awards, as well as invitations to major events such as:

‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†*COP 30* ‚Äì United Nations Climate Change Conference 2025.  
‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†*4th National Week of Professional and Technological Education*.

![Event image](https://i.postimg.cc/fyztyw76/Foto-3.png)

‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†*Gold medal at the WFCP Award* ‚Äì World Federation of Colleges and Polytechnics (SDG category).

![WFCP award image](https://i.postimg.cc/kGTVtkfD/Foto-4.png)

‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†*1st place in DLJ* ‚Äì Liga Jovem Challenge (high school category, social impact, and entrepreneurship).

![DLJ award image](https://i.postimg.cc/c1htjn0Z/Foto-5.png)

Supporting QUIAMA means contributing to a sustainable and socially responsible model.

## OUR PURPOSE

More than just an academic project, QUIAMA is a movement aligned with the UN SDGs, developing solutions for a more balanced and sustainable future.

*Join this transformation.*

---

# DONATE TO QUIAMA: SOCIAL IMPACT AND SUSTAINABILITY

Each contribution strengthens initiatives that combine sustainability, education, and community development. Our commitment is to turn knowledge into action, expanding opportunities and generating positive impact.

## STRENGTHENING THE AGROECOLOGICAL GARDEN

The Agroecological Garden is one of QUIAMA's pillars, ensuring sustainable raw materials for our actions. Your donation will allow us to:

‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†Restructure and expand the space, increasing the diversity of cultivated species.  
‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†Improve irrigation systems, optimizing water use.  
‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†Implement new agroecological practices for more sustainable cultivation.

## SUSTAINABLE PRODUCTION AND TECHNOLOGY

Financial support will enable:

‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†Acquisition of essential equipment for producing herbal remedies and natural cosmetics.  
‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†Expansion of eco-friendly input production, respecting green chemistry principles.  
‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†Use of sustainable packaging, reducing environmental impact.  
‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†Adoption of efficient and responsible production processes, prioritizing clean energy and biodegradable materials.

## TRAINING IN FAVELAS: INCOME, EDUCATION, AND SOCIAL TRANSFORMATION

QUIAMA brings knowledge and opportunities to vulnerable communities. Your contribution enables:

‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†Expansion of natural cosmetics courses, training residents to generate income.  
‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†Promotion of community entrepreneurship with a focus on sustainable production.  
‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†Creation and strengthening of Agroforestry Systems (SAFs) in favelas, promoting food security and environmental regeneration.  
‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†Environmental and agroecological education in underserved areas, training multipliers who expand social impact.

The knowledge generated within communities ensures long-lasting and self-sustaining impact.

![Image of courses and SAFs](https://i.postimg.cc/WbfFpcdH/Foto-6.png)

## HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTION MAKES A DIFFERENCE

Each donation strengthens a sustainable model that benefits both people and the environment.

‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†Your support helps create real opportunities for training and income generation.  
‚Ä¢‚Å†  ‚Å†By contributing to QUIAMA, you become part of a social and environmental transformation.

*Donate now and be part of this change!*

project.title: Sarau do Calango
project.description:
## Sobre
O Sarau do Calango completar√° 9 anos de atividades no dia 4 de maio de 2025, consolidando-se como um dos principais espa√ßos de express√£o art√≠stica e cultural da Zona Oeste do Rio de Janeiro. Ao longo desses anos, o evento promoveu mais de 80 edi√ß√µes, proporcionando oportunidades para centenas de artistas e fortalecendo o acesso √† cultura em uma regi√£o carente de equipamentos culturais. Seu impacto vai al√©m da arte, tornando-se um ponto de encontro e resist√™ncia para a comunidade local. # M√©todo e A√ß√µes Utilizadas no Espet√°culo "Carro√ßa da Hist√≥ria"
O Espet√°culo "Carro√ßa da Hist√≥ria", idealizado pelo Instituto Arteiros, utiliza o teatro como ferramenta de transforma√ß√£o social. # T√©cnicas e Abordagens

‚Ä¢	Cena Final de Obras Cl√°ssicas: Encena√ß√£o de trechos finais de textos teatrais cl√°ssicos, proporcionar aos atores a oportunidade de explorar diferentes estilos dram√°ticos.

‚Ä¢	Teatro de Rua e Intera√ß√£o com o P√∫blico: Apresenta√ß√µes em espa√ßos p√∫blicos, envolver a comunidade e estimular a participa√ß√£o ativa do p√∫blico na experi√™ncia teatral.

A pe√ßa traz uma dramaturgia inovadora inspirada nas F√°bulas de Esopo e utiliza elementos de diferentes tradi√ß√µes teatrais, como:

O espet√°culo utiliza um cen√°rio artesanal e simb√≥lico com t√©cnica de Upcyncling, criou um ambiente de jogo e imagina√ß√£o. Com uma marca√ß√£o c√™nica forte e um ritmo din√¢mico, a pe√ßa √© comparada a um jogo de xadrez, onde cada movimento dos atores √© pensado para construir uma narrativa envolvente e fluida.

[![Dia-das-Crian-as.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/76qDn9nr/Dia-das-Crian-as.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/PLVBtm7S)

[![Pr-mio-Periferia-2024.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/Hk7pYVkR/Pr-mio-Periferia-2024.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/G4d0z3Yx)

# Instituto Arteiros: 15 Years Transforming Lives in Cidade de Deus

Instituto Arteiros is an organization that, for the past 15 years, has been promoting social and cultural transformation in Cidade de Deus, Rio de Janeiro. Founded with the mission of strengthening the community through art, education, and family engagement, the Institute has established itself as an essential space for personal and collective development, impacting thousands of lives throughout its journey.

# Program Structured by Strategic Pillars

The actions of Instituto Arteiros are organized into four strategic pillars, ensuring a comprehensive and sustainable approach:

## Pillar I ‚Äì Culture
‚Ä¢ Theater classes for all ages.
‚Ä¢ Production and presentation of community performances and shows.
‚Ä¢ Visual arts, audiovisual, and literature workshops ‚Äì Audiovisual Lab.
‚Ä¢ Appreciation of Afro-Brazilian and Indigenous culture.

## Pillar II ‚Äì Education
‚Ä¢ Literacy and school reinforcement programs.
‚Ä¢ College prep courses.
‚Ä¢ Community Library ‚Äì Encouraging reading and creative writing.

Pillar III ‚Äì Community Development
‚Ä¢ Food security projects and distribution of basic food baskets.
‚Ä¢ Te Acolhendo ‚Äì Support gatherings for neurodivergent children's mothers.
‚Ä¢ Human Rights Literacy ‚Äì Training in human rights and citizenship.

## Pillar IV ‚Äì Cross-Cutting Events
‚Ä¢ Black Consciousness Week, Women‚Äôs Week, LGBTQIAP+ Week.
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúDinner with Art.‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Community Cinearteiros screenings.
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúDesenrolo‚Äù and ‚ÄúExperimenta.‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Cultural celebrations such as Festa Julina and the Institute‚Äôs Anniversary.

# Success and Impact Indicators

Monthly Impact
‚Ä¢ 500 people visit the Institute daily.
‚Ä¢ 250 students enrolled in courses and activities.
‚Ä¢ 3,000 people indirectly impacted through the network.

# Overall Impact (Last 5 Years)
‚Ä¢ 500 people visit the Institute daily.
‚Ä¢ 750 students directly benefited from the programs.
‚Ä¢ 40,000 people indirectly impacted.

These figures demonstrate how Instituto Arteiros has become a transformative space for the community, providing real growth opportunities for children, youth, and adults. With its ongoing commitment to art, education, and community empowerment, the Institute continues its mission of creating a fairer, more inclusive, and more creative future for all.

Impacto Mensal

‚Ä¢3.000 pessoas impactadas indiretamente pela rede de atua√ß√£o.
Impacto Geral (√öltimos 05 anos)

‚Ä¢40.000 pessoas impactadas indiretamente.
Esses n√∫meros evidenciam como o Instituto Arteiros se tornou um espa√ßo de transforma√ß√£o para a comunidade, oferecendo oportunidades concretas de crescimento para crian√ßas, jovens e adultos. Com um compromisso cont√≠nuo com a arte, a educa√ß√£o e o fortalecimento comunit√°rio, o Instituto segue sua miss√£o de criar um futuro mais justo, inclusivo e criativo para todos.

[![Dia-das-Crian-as.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/76qDn9nr/Dia-das-Crian-as.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/PLVBtm7S)

[![Pr-mio-Periferia-2024.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/Hk7pYVkR/Pr-mio-Periferia-2024.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/G4d0z3Yx)

# Instituto Arteiros: 15 Years Transforming Lives in Cidade de Deus

Instituto Arteiros is an organization that, for the past 15 years, has been promoting social and cultural transformation in Cidade de Deus, Rio de Janeiro. Founded with the mission of strengthening the community through art, education, and family engagement, the Institute has established itself as an essential space for personal and collective development, impacting thousands of lives throughout its journey.

# Program Structured by Strategic Pillars

The actions of Instituto Arteiros are organized into four strategic pillars, ensuring a comprehensive and sustainable approach:

## Pillar I ‚Äì Culture
‚Ä¢ Theater classes for all ages.
‚Ä¢ Production and presentation of community performances and shows.
‚Ä¢ Visual arts, audiovisual, and literature workshops ‚Äì Audiovisual Lab.
‚Ä¢ Appreciation of Afro-Brazilian and Indigenous culture.

## Pillar II ‚Äì Education
‚Ä¢ Literacy and school reinforcement programs.
‚Ä¢ College prep courses.
‚Ä¢ Community Library ‚Äì Encouraging reading and creative writing.

Pillar III ‚Äì Community Development
‚Ä¢ Food security projects and distribution of basic food baskets.
‚Ä¢ Te Acolhendo ‚Äì Support gatherings for neurodivergent children's mothers.
‚Ä¢ Human Rights Literacy ‚Äì Training in human rights and citizenship.

## Pillar IV ‚Äì Cross-Cutting Events
‚Ä¢ Black Consciousness Week, Women‚Äôs Week, LGBTQIAP+ Week.
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúDinner with Art.‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Community Cinearteiros screenings.
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúDesenrolo‚Äù and ‚ÄúExperimenta.‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Cultural celebrations such as Festa Julina and the Institute‚Äôs Anniversary.

# Success and Impact Indicators

Monthly Impact
‚Ä¢ 500 people visit the Institute daily.
‚Ä¢ 250 students enrolled in courses and activities.
‚Ä¢ 3,000 people indirectly impacted through the network.

# Overall Impact (Last 5 Years)
‚Ä¢ 500 people visit the Institute daily.
‚Ä¢ 750 students directly benefited from the programs.
‚Ä¢ 40,000 people indirectly impacted.

These figures demonstrate how Instituto Arteiros has become a transformative space for the community, providing real growth opportunities for children, youth, and adults. With its ongoing commitment to art, education, and community empowerment, the Institute continues its mission of creating a fairer, more inclusive, and more creative future for all.

project.description:
## **Como declarar doa√ß√µes internacionais recebidas via Gitcoin**
Essa √© uma d√∫vida super importante e recorrente para organiza√ß√µes brasileiras que est√£o acessando financiamento web3. Abaixo explico como funcionaria, com foco nas **doa√ß√µes recebidas do exterior via Gitcoin**, e os principais pontos legais e cont√°beis para entidades com CNPJ no Brasil.


[![5118841954833116902.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/7hmX19dy/5118841954833116902.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/D44qnr7C)

![5e9f6066-eb9f-474e-94d5-f2696ffc3c11](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Sk7BCxfpkg.png)

teste para o streaming [relatorios da coleta do dia 15/03](https://www.google.com.br)


### 1. **Recebendo doa√ß√µes do exterior**
- A Gitcoin normalmente envia os fundos em **criptomoeda (como ETH ou USDC)** para uma wallet indicada pelo projeto.
- Para declarar isso no Brasil, √© necess√°rio:
- **converter esse valor para reais (R$)** com base na **cota√ß√£o do dia do recebimento**.
- registrar como **receita de doa√ß√£o internacional** no seu sistema cont√°bil.

---

### 2. **Natureza jur√≠dica da organiza√ß√£o (com CNPJ)**

#### a) **Associa√ß√£o ou OSCIP/OSC**
- Se a sua organiza√ß√£o √© **sem fins lucrativos**, registrada como associa√ß√£o, instituto, ONG etc.:
- Pode **receber doa√ß√µes internacionais** legalmente, inclusive em cripto.
- Idealmente, converte os criptoativos em reais e **declara como ‚ÄúDoa√ß√£o do exterior‚Äù**.
- Precisa fazer **c√¢mbio legalizado** se quiser trazer esse valor para o sistema banc√°rio tradicional.

#### b) **Empresa (LTDA ou MEI)**
- Se for uma empresa com CNPJ comum (com fins lucrativos), a entrada ser√° classificada como **receita financeira ou presta√ß√£o de servi√ßo**, dependendo do contexto.
- Neste caso, pode haver **incid√™ncia de impostos** como IRPJ, CSLL, PIS e COFINS.

---

### 3. **Convers√£o de cripto e compliance**

- Uma organiza√ß√£o pode manter os ativos em cripto, **mas o ideal √© converter para reais** (em exchanges ou P2P confi√°veis) para:
  - registrar no livro cont√°bil,
  - usar no pagamento de despesas legais,
  - prestar contas a √≥rg√£os p√∫blicos ou auditores.

- A Receita Federal ainda **n√£o possui regras espec√≠ficas para ONGs que recebem em cripto**, ent√£o o melhor caminho √©:
  - **converter para reais** via exchange (Binance, Mercado Bitcoin, Foxbit, etc.),
  - enviar os recursos para a conta banc√°ria da ONG,
  - registrar a entrada como ‚ÄúDoa√ß√£o Internacional‚Äù (natureza de receita sem contrapresta√ß√£o).

---

### 4. **Documenta√ß√£o exigida**

Mesmo sendo via Gitcoin (web3), √© recomend√°vel manter documenta√ß√£o:

| Documento | Finalidade |
|----------|-------------|
| **Wallet address da organiza√ß√£o** | Identifica√ß√£o do recebimento |
| **Comprovante da transa√ß√£o on-chain** | Pode ser um link do Etherscan |
| **Print ou export do Gitcoin Grants Round** | Mostrando a listagem do projeto |
| **Declara√ß√£o do valor convertido** | Com base na cota√ß√£o do dia, para escritura√ß√£o |
| **Nota cont√°bil interna** | Gerada pelo contador como ‚Äúdoa√ß√£o recebida do exterior‚Äù |

---

## üí° Dicas pr√°ticas

- Trabalhe com um contador que **entenda minimamente cripto e doa√ß√µes internacionais**.
- Sempre converta valores para reais de forma **transparente e rastre√°vel**.
- Se for uma ONG, voc√™ pode registrar essas entradas como **receita isenta**, desde que use para fins sociais compat√≠veis com seu estatuto.

---

## üß† Exemplo pr√°tico



### üìã Relat√≥rio de Presta√ß√£o de Contas ‚Äì Doa√ß√£o Recebida via Gitcoin





[![5118841954833116902.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/7hmX19dy/5118841954833116902.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/D44qnr7C)

project.title: S√≠tio Ressoar
project.description:
"S√≠tio Ressoar is a project that promotes the reintegration of humans with nature, focusing on soil regeneration, reforestation, and the production of truly sustainable food. Through Syntropic Agriculture, we aim to present an alternative path to the excessive consumption of resources that leads to scarcity. By working in harmony with nature, we believe it is possible to generate resources and achieve abundance.

We incorporate a variety of sustainable knowledge and practices into our daily lives, such as bioconstruction, permaculture, alchemy, spagyrics, herbal medicine, and more, creating a solid foundation for more conscious and sustainable practices.

Our primary goal is to become a support hub for everyone who wishes to embark on this journey of reconnection with nature.

Currently, our greatest challenge is creating the infrastructure at the site to welcome people and disseminate knowledge, expanding the impact of this sustainable transformation."
_____________________________________________ ___

"S√≠tio Ressoar √© um projeto que promove a reintegra√ß√£o do ser humano com a natureza, com foco na regenera√ß√£o do solo, reflorestamento e produ√ß√£o de alimentos verdadeiramente sustent√°veis. Por meio da agricultura Sintr√≥pica, buscamos apresentar um caminho alternativo ao consumo exacerbado de recursos, que nos leva √† escassez. Trabalhando em harmonia com a natureza, acreditamos ser poss√≠vel gerar recursos e alcan√ßar a abund√¢ncia.

Incorporamos ao nosso cotidiano uma variedade de saberes e pr√°ticas sustent√°veis, como bioconstru√ß√£o, permacultura, alquimia, espagiria, fitoterapia, entre outros, criando uma base s√≥lida para pr√°ticas mais conscientes e sustent√°veis.

 Nosso principal objetivo √© nos tornarmos um ponto de apoio para todos que desejam trilhar esse caminho de reconex√£o com a natureza..

Atualmente, nosso maior desafio √© criar uma estrutura no s√≠tio que permita receber pessoas e disseminar conhecimento, ampliando o impacto dessa transforma√ß√£o sustent√°vel."

project.description:
üü†üå± What if a degraded urban area beneath power lines could become a vibrant center of life?

üìç In the heart of Rio‚Äôs North Zone, CPP Luzes do Amanh√£ is turning this vision into reality.

üèûÔ∏è Once a dumping ground, now a certified organic agroforest:

üåø 100+ species  
üë©‚Äçüåæ Monthly volunteer days

All co-created by the community ‚Äî with zero irrigation, zero fertilizer.

‚òÄÔ∏è What we do:

- Welcome children from neighborhood schools and social projects in the favela on educational days in the agroforestry;

- Grow certified organic food and share it with everyone who visits the space;

- Contribute to the participatory guarantee system in an agroecology network;

- Organize public events with cultural and educational programs;

- Protect local biodiversity, with +100 species registered on our land, including fruit trees, PANCS, and medicinal plants.


üáßüá∑üå± E se uma √°rea urbana degradada abaixo de linhas de energia pudesse se tornar um vibrante centro de vida?

üåø Mais de 100 esp√©cies
üë©‚Äçüåæ Dias mensais de voluntariado
üéí Visitas escolares semanais

Tudo cocriado pela comunidade ‚Äî com zero irriga√ß√£o e   zero fertilizantes.

‚òÄÔ∏è O que n√≥s fazemos:

- Recebemos crian√ßas das escolas do bairro e dos projetos sociais da favela em dias educativos na agrofloresta;

- Cultivamos alimentos org√¢nicos certificados e dividimos com todos que frequentam o espa√ßo;

- Contribu√≠mos no sistema participativo de garantia em uma rede de agroecologia;

- Protegemos a biodiversidade local, com +100 esp√©cies registradas em nosso terreno que incluem frut√≠feras, PANCS, e medicinais.

project.title: Muda Outras Economias
project.description:
Muda is a collaborative network that created it's own social currency. 

Muda network has a diverse group of people, and it was initiated in Rio de Janeiro. 

Muda is committed to strengthening sharing practices rooted in the principles of solidarity and circular economies, processes grounded in social technologies and ancestral knowledge, and facilitated by modern technology. 

The community brings together art, education, agroecology, and technology in an interdisciplinary way.

We use social currencies as a way to onboard people into web3 and regenerative practices. Starting from Rio, we are already all over Brazil and slowly starting to collaborate with communities in Costa Rica

project.title: Jardim Arom√°tico
project.description:
## Jardim Arom√°tico



Somos clandestinos oficializados.

O Jardim Arom√°tico √© uma agrofloresta urbana na Pra√ßa Jos√© de Alencar localizada no bairro Flamengo no Rio de Janeiro.
Seguimos as ideias de Ernst G√∂tsch, inspirados na sintropia entre esp√©cies para o plantio de alimentos na cidade.

Fundado em 2017 por integrantes do [Movimento Transition Brasil](https://bit.ly/4kO3ymD).


Formalizado junto √† Prefeitura do Rio em 2018, com um termo de compromisso para ado√ß√£o da pra√ßa e realiza√ß√£o do projeto.
 ![IMG-20180505-WA0029](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/SyaExv7pyl.jpg)

[![Jdim-Aromatic1.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/g2snxcN6/Jdim-Aromatic1.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/rDd8bT68)

Nosso trabalho √© volunt√°rio, sem chefes ou subordinados ‚Äì cada pessoa escolhe iniciativas para contribuir.

### Priorizamos o cultivo de:
- Plantas aliment√≠cias n√£o convencionais (PANCs)

- Ervas arom√°ticas e medicinais

- Temperos e frut√≠feras de pequeno porte

- Conhe√ßa mais no nosso [**Guia R√°pido**](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1cZSm8mSYgYzZe3u_9md0Q2wwx1EPlkd6/edit?usp=drivesdk&ouid=116693886446909051823&rtpof=true&sd=true).

![P_20190907_121038_vHDR_On_HP](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/H1u2xv76kl.jpg)

## O QUE BUSCAMOS TRANSFORMAR?


* Celebramos a **riqueza da vida** ressurgindo na cidade.  

* Transformamos as **rela√ß√µes entre pessoas, a Pra√ßa e a paisagem**.  

* Convidamos a uma **mudan√ßa de ritmo** no dia a dia agitado.  
* Incentivamos o **conv√≠vio, o di√°logo e a valoriza√ß√£o da vizinhan√ßa**.  
* Propomos enxergar o espa√ßo e as pessoas al√©m da invisibilidade.  
* Desafiamos a ideia de que **"o que √© p√∫blico n√£o √© de ningu√©m"**.  
* Questionamos a cultura de apenas **reclamar e esperar a√ß√£o dos √≥rg√£os p√∫blicos**.


## COMO PROPOMOS E REALIZAMOS SOLU√á√ïES?

Nosso objetivo √© a **constru√ß√£o coletiva de um sonho comunit√°rio**, periodicamente revisto e atualizado. Propomos uma nova consci√™ncia: **a responsabilidade de cada um pelo que √© de todos**. Temos por princ√≠pio ouvir e **dialogar com a sociedade** e como combust√≠vel a **alegria de cuidar do coletivo**. Tanto o espa√ßo, quanto o cuidado e as colheitas s√£o p√∫blicos e **compartilhados**. 
![bf8368cc-8075-4cd7-8ad9-72f8b92d9f86](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Skp0eDmp1e.jpg)

## O QUE J√Å REALIZAMOS

* **Autogest√£o financeira:** sem financiamento governamental ou privado; conta banc√°ria em nome de uma volunt√°ria com gest√£o coletiva e regras de transpar√™ncia.  

* **Capta√ß√£o de recursos:** contribui√ß√µes volunt√°rias, doa√ß√µes em eventos, feiras e financiamento coletivo online, com destaque para a campanha que viabilizou o painel grafitado.  
* **Cultivo e manejo:** 8 anos de mutir√µes quinzenais para manuten√ß√£o do espa√ßo.  


* **Educa√ß√£o e oficinas:** atividades sobre agroflorestas, jardinagem, compostagem, artes com material reciclado, poda, plantio e outros temas.  

* **Compostagem comunit√°ria:** tr√™s composteiras foram utilizadas, mas o manejo foi interrompido por desafios urbanos e falta de recursos.  
* **Voluntariado:** dois dias anuais com a Catedral Metodista (2022 e 2023), envolvendo cerca de 80 volunt√°rios em revitaliza√ß√£o da Pra√ßa.


* **Parcerias e trocas:** colabora√ß√£o com v√°rias iniciativas agroecol√≥gicas e neg√≥cios locais para troca de conhecimento, sementes e mudas.  

* **Arte e grafite:** campanha financeira em 2023 viabilizou um mural grafitado por dois artistas, com apoio de crowdfunding e com√©rcio local.  


* **Eventos especiais:** "Outubro no Pra√ßa" com rodas de conversa, oficinas de plantio, desenho, grafite e feira agroecol√≥gica.  



* **Projeto Calend√°rio:** terceiro ano consecutivo de produ√ß√£o de um calend√°rio ilustrado por artistas volunt√°rios para arrecada√ß√£o de fundos. 


* **An√°lise do solo:** parceria com a UFRJ para estudo e melhoria da composi√ß√£o do solo da Pra√ßa.  

* **Interc√¢mbio e redes:** trocas de experi√™ncias com localidades como Vale das Videiras, Bras√≠lia e Bel√©m; participa√ß√£o no Transition Brasil (confira o Practising Transition \- Dia de Pr√°tica da Transi√ß√£o Glocal, em 04-04-25 ([https://bit.ly/4iQiDCp](https://bit.ly/4iQiDCp) ) e eventos globais.  

* **Divulga√ß√£o:** principais a√ß√µes documentadas
    - [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/jardimaromatic?igsh=MWRzOHF2dHE5M3hhag==)    
    - [Relat√≥rio visual online](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YnIdDRCfu5CQbl6mxr073XWGXfv6QQ6R/view?usp=sharing)

![WhatsApp Image 2025-01-17 at 15.25.53](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HJTTmPX6ye.jpg)
![WhatsApp Image 2024-09-20 at 05.49.54 (1)](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Sk-aBwQ6Jx.jpg)

![criancas pintando](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HJuo0dmayl.jpg)

![WhatsApp Image 2024-09-20 at 05.04.28 (1)](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rJrIXwQTkx.jpg)
![WhatsApp Image 2024-09-20 at 05.04.28](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/SkB8XDQ6Jl.jpg)
![WhatsApp Image 2024-09-20 at 05.25.44 (2)](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1-arv7Tkg.jpg)
## Equipe principal:
[Renata Nacif:](https://www.instagram.com/renatanacif?igsh=cmY2NWl2dnZvZG54) atriz, servidora em sa√∫de, doula e idealizadora do Jardim Arom√°tico.

[Virg√≠nia Maria:](https://www.instagram.com/virginiamariabarcellos?igsh=aDFvbmFkdGRybDI5) atriz, produtora cultural e educadora.

[Pollyana Silva:](https://www.instagram.com/pollyhsilva?igsh=czN2bmticjc3bmk1) respons√°vel pelas finan√ßas e pelo projeto do Calend√°rio.

[Jos√© Joseph:](https://www.instagram.com/josephmichel22?igsh=MTI0czhpdTU1d204OQ== ) bi√≥logo em forma√ß√£o e respons√°vel pelos dias de cultivo. Desenvolveu estudo onde inspirado em Byung Chul Han, o Jardim Arom√°tico √© um espa√ßo de regenera√ß√£o comunit√°ria, afetiva e est√©tica, contrapondo-se √† "Sociedade do Cansa√ßo".

[Ana Castro:](https://www.instagram.com/ana_castroborges?igsh=MTdnMDRtMm43NzNocQ== ) agrofloresteira e volunt√°ria ativa nos mutir√µes.

Os recursos arrecadados ser√£o destinados principalmente ao custeio da fase final de desenvolvimento e lan√ßamento do aplicativo **Lumiar.shop**, uma plataforma digital para conectar empreendedores, produtores locais e consumidores, impulsionando a economia circular e sustent√°vel da regi√£o, bem como para manuten√ß√£o e aprimoramento cont√≠nuo do aplicativo oficial do **F√≥rum Popular de Cultura de Lumiar e Biorregi√£o** ([dispon√≠vel aqui](https://pwa4.app.vc/forum_popular_de_cultura)), ferramenta essencial para integra√ß√£o, comunica√ß√£o e fortalecimento da rede comunit√°ria local.

As atividades planejadas incluem:

- **Finaliza√ß√£o t√©cnica do aplicativo Lumiar.shop:**  
  Investiremos em UX/UI, programa√ß√£o avan√ßada, hospedagem, suporte t√©cnico e treinamento inicial dos usu√°rios, garantindo acessibilidade e estabilidade da plataforma.

- **Atualiza√ß√£o e manuten√ß√£o do aplicativo oficial do F√≥rum:**  
  Custos relacionados √† melhoria cont√≠nua do aplicativo do F√≥rum, garantindo funcionalidades eficazes para a articula√ß√£o dos grupos culturais, ambientais e produtivos, fortalecendo a governan√ßa coletiva e comunica√ß√£o comunit√°ria.

- **Capacita√ß√£o pr√°tica de empreendedores locais:**  
  Oficinas presenciais e remotas para capacitar pelo menos 30 empreendedores locais a utilizar eficazmente o aplicativo Lumiar.shop, estimulando o com√©rcio justo e a economia sustent√°vel.

- **A√ß√µes de onboarding Web3 no GitCoin:**  
  Realizaremos atividades espec√≠ficas para inserir pelo menos 50 produtores, comerciantes e prestadores de servi√ßos locais na plataforma GitCoin, auxiliando-os a criar carteiras digitais Web3 e ampliando as oportunidades de capta√ß√£o digital futura.

- **Evento presencial "O Lixo nosso de cada dia":**  
  Rodas de conversa e debates abertos sobre gest√£o de res√≠duos s√≥lidos e mercado justo, envolvendo ao menos 200 pessoas da comunidade. Recursos ser√£o aplicados em infraestrutura b√°sica, material educativo e apoio log√≠stico essencial para realiza√ß√£o do evento.

Com essa distribui√ß√£o estrat√©gica dos recursos, fortalecemos nossa infraestrutura tecnol√≥gica local, potencializamos o com√©rcio justo e sustent√°vel e ampliamos o impacto social e ambiental de nossas a√ß√µes na biorregi√£o.
